data.why:
* APT-Method, initially incorporating APT::Method, APT::Method::LWP
    and APT::Method::HTTPS, an OO family implementing backend handlers
    for Debian's APT package manager. (working and in use, needs only
    packaging) * Log4Error, which hooks into Error.pm and adds a context
    warning system for more human-understandable backtraces; syntax
    becomes: try { ... } warns { "message" } catch Error with { ... }
    otherwise { ... } finally { ... } and can channel warnings via
    Log4Perl or Log::Dispatch. (prototype working but needs untangling
    from some proprietary code) * IO::SafeAtomicFile, a subclass of
    IO::AtomicFile that doesn't autocommit during destruction. (needs
    only packaging)
